repnme.cdata!:
Russia - Development of the State
            Statistical System Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Development of the State
            Statistical System Project (STASYS) for Russian Federation
            were as follows: outcomes were satisfactory, the risk to
            development outcome was low, Bank performance was
            satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was satisfactory.
            An important lesson learned in the project pertains to the
            complex phasing and timing of Information Technology (IT)
            modernization processes. First, the coordinating of the
            multiple facets of IT modernization, e.g. equipment
            delivery, software testing, network installation, and civil
            works for computing centers, especially in the diverse all
            Russia regional frameworks as Federal State Statistical
            Service (RosStat) has is complex, requires closer monitoring
            and allowances for unforeseen delays. Relatedly, software
            contracts require more realistic contractual periods. In
            general, time allowances should be provided for
            unforeseeable delays and project risks related to the
            untimely fulfillment of interrelated operations should be
            considered during project preparation. A second and positive
            lesson from the IT experience under STASYS was the prudence
            of both a systems-design, and a participatory and
            step-by-step approach taken by RosStat. Finally, the use of
            an external agency as the Project Implementation Unit (PIU)
            can still be an appropriate model provided the main
            beneficiary is fully committed and engaged in project activities.

repnme.cdata!:
Russian Federation - State Statistical
            System (STASYS) Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The importance of macroeconomic
            management issues has been addressed within the strategic
            framework, whereby a number of such issues, together with
            public sector reforms will be enhanced through the State
            Statistical System (STASYS) Project. The development
            objectives of the project are to restructure the state
            statistical system for Goskomstat, and strengthen other data
            collection agencies. The main components include: 1) the
            institutional strengthening of Goskomstat, which will
            improve its organization and management, as well as its
            strategy and perspective planning. Additionally, fostering
            knowledge of standards and methodology, will be emphasized,
            as will the strengthening of statistical infrastructure, and
            the reorganization of data collection, processing, and
            dissemination; 2) the institutional strengthening and
            technical assistance to data collection agencies, which will
            improve financial statistics, with the introduction of a
            compilation system. Furthermore, improvements in the balance
            of payments' coverage and quality will be enhanced,
            through utilization methods and information for economic
            monitoring and forecasting, hence improving the processing
            of vital statistics; and, 3) a project management, to
            establish a Directorate, supporting the development of
            STASYS for program management.
